thread.title: As Blind Date returns here are the celebrities who appeared on the show before finding fame
thread.title_full: As Blind Date returns here are the celebrities who appeared on the show before finding fame

author: Rebecca Merriman
title: As Blind Date returns here are the celebrities who appeared on the show before finding fame
text:
Celebs As Blind Date returns here are the celebrities who appeared on the show before finding fame From Nikki Grahame to Amanda Holden, these stars all faced Cilla Black's grilling on the iconic dating show Share Which celebrities tried to find love on the ultimate dating show? Share   
Hit television show Blind Date is to make a comeback on Channel 5 after more than 13 years off air. 
The popular dating programme was fronted by the late Cilla Black for its entire 18-year run on ITV. 
Here's a look back at the most famous faces who popped up to face Cilla's probing questions. 
More than a few celebrities tried to find love - or fame - on the ultimate dating show 
Here are the lucky few who got to appear alongside Cilla. Amanda Holden 
Probably the most well known, Britain's Got Talent star Amanda Holden appeared on the show as contestant number two in 1991 and actually didn't look that much different to she does now. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Jenny Falconer 
Another presenter, Jenny Falconer was another famous face that popped up, this time in 1994 and while she didn't find love with her match Donny, she did fall for the enigmatic host. 
Jenny spoke about her experience on the show earlier this year when Cilla passed away and said it was the "lovely lady" that inspired her to become a presenter herself. 
"She inspired me to get into television," she added. Jenny with Cilla and her date Donny in 1994 (Photo: ITV) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Ed Byrne 
Before his career as a comedian and appearances on panel shows such as Mock The Week, Ed appeared as one of the three hopefuls. 
Sadly - despite his comic abilities - he didn't get picked for a date. 
“I was one of the three blokes behind the screen, but I didn’t get chosen, the stripper from King’s Lynn was,” he told the Liverpool Echo in 2013. 
“He was actually quite a nice guy. But the date was a day out in Cambridge, which considering the guy was from King’s Lynn was pretty s***.” Ed Byrne failed to score a date - even with Cilla's help Mark Speight 
The SMart presenter - who tragically died in 2008 - appeared on the show in 1989. 
He went on to front the BBC children's art show in 1994. Mark Speight Ortis Deley 
Another children's TV presenters, Ortis made his first ever TV appearance on Blind Date in 1995. 
Remembering Cilla as the person who gave him his break into TV, he thanked her for the "memories" in a touching tweet when she passed away in August. Ortis Deley 
He wrote: "Just heard the news of Cilla Black's passing. I owe that lady a lot. Thanks for the memories/opportunity. #RIPCillaBlack " Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
